paper_metadata.title: Diagnosis and treatment of cardiac amyloidosis: position statement of the German Cardiac Society (DGK)
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with heart failure symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most common mutations is the p.Val142Ile mutation, which occurs in 3–4% of the African population.
The most common mutations is the p.Val142Ile mutation, which occurs in 3–4% of the African population.

functional_data.summary: The p.Val142Ile mutation destabilizes the TTR tetramer structure, increasing amyloidogenic monomer formation.
assays: Functional assays measuring amyloid fibril formation

variants.additional_notes: The p.Val50Met mutation is also mentioned but no specific data was extracted for it.
key_quotes: To date, more than 100 mutations have been described in the TTR gene, although most ATTRv amyloidoses are caused by p.Val142Ile (also known as Val122Ile) and p.Val50Met (also known as Val30Met) mutations.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was comprehensive and detailed regarding the TTR gene variants.
